text: Deon Lendore (28 October 1992 â€“ 10 January 2022) was a Trinidadian sprinter. Lendore won a silver medal in the 400 metres at the 2011 Pan American Junior Athletics Championships in Miramar, Florida. He was born in Arima, Trinidad. Lendore won a bronze medal at the 2012 Summer Olympics. Lendore died in a car crash in Texas on 10 January 2022, at the age of 29. Olympian Deon Lendore killed in crash Trinidad Express Newspapers ==References== Category:1992 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Olympians for Trinidad and Tobago Category:Olympic bronze medalists Category:Road accident deaths Category:Sprinters Category:Trinidad and Tobago athletes Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Olympics
title: Deon Lendore
